_header: There is no mirth under the sky
_description: In praise of his lady — six eight-line stanzas with refrain, ‘Be trew lady for I you truste’

BodSelSup52.First Lines:
Thayr ys no myrth vnder the skyHarpyng lutyng nor no mery
                    dance…
BodSelSup52.Last Lines:
…When I think apon your love so freBy trew lady for I you
                    truste
BodSelSup52.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope,
                        ed.  
             Secular Lyrics of the XIV and XV Centuries.
         2nd ed. Oxford: Clarendon, 1955: 136-8.
